name: A LADYCAITRIONA Quiz | Words in Words for Kids | 10 Questions

questions.text: Using only letters in "LADYCAITRIONA", find a 4-letter word for a large serving dish, like you might use at school.
questions.explanation:
Tray.

	A tray at a school or a restaurant is usually a rounded rectangle that can hold a plate or two, your silverware, and a drink, so it easier to carry it all.  You can bring it to the table all at once instead of taking two trips.

questions.text: Using only letters in "LADYCAITRIONA", find a 4-letter word for a woman.
questions.explanation:
Lady.

	A lady is a woman, usually used to mean an elegant and beautiful woman.  When someone on stage talks to the audience, they might call them ladies and gentlemen.

questions.text: Using only letters in "LADYCAITRIONA", find a 6-letter word for a type of movie, or what the director says when they start shooting a movie.
questions.explanation:
Action.

	A director might yell "action" if he wants the actors to start performing.  Some intense movies are called action movies.  Action can also be motion, like what you do.  Have you ever heard the saying, "Actions speak louder than words"?

questions.text: Using only letters in "LADYCAITRIONA", find a 5-letter word for someone who might perform on stage.
questions.explanation:
Actor.

	An actor is someone who performs a play on stage, or acts in a movie or a TV show.  Actor can mean both man and woman performers, but it usually refers to a man who performs, while a woman would be called an actress.

questions.text: Using only letters in "LADYCAITRIONA", find a 3-letter word for a feline.
questions.explanation:
Cat.

	A cat is sometimes said to have nine lives, and cats can usually land on their feet when they fall from a high place.  This is because of their spines, which are much more flexible than ours are!

questions.text: Using only letters in "LADYCAITRIONA", find a 5-letter word for a type of vehicle that goes on tracks, also called a locomotive.
questions.explanation:
Train.

	A train is sometimes call a locomotive, and it travels on tracks.  Train can also mean to teach, like you train a dog to do tricks.

questions.text: Using only letters in "LADYCAITRIONA", find a 4-letter word for water that falls down from the sky.
questions.explanation:
Rain.

	Water falls in the sky in all different ways: rain, snow, hail, or even sleet, which is sort of an icy-rain mixture.  Rain can be warm, or it can be very cold.  It is often said that no raindrop (or snowflake) hits the ground on the exact same spot twice.

questions.text: Using only letters in "LADYCAITRIONA", find a 3-letter word meaning the opposite of night.
questions.explanation:
Day.

	Day means the time when most people are awake, and when the sun is out.  Early in the day is the morning, in the middle of the day is the afternoon, and late in the day is the evening.  When it is dark out, it is called the nighttime.

questions.text: Using only letters in "LADYCAITRIONA", find a 4-letter word for a jacket you would wear if it is cold outside.
questions.explanation:
Coat.

	A coat, or a jacket, is something you wear when it's cold outside.  For instance, if it is below freezing outside, you might wear your big coat that keeps you nice and warm.  But you wouldn't want to wear this coat when it was a hot and sunny day at the beach!

questions.text: Using only letters in "LADYCAITRIONA", find a 4-letter word for something that a dog wags.
questions.explanation:
Tail.

	A dog is often known to wag his tail, which is the extra "limb" in the back.  Humans don't have tails, at least, not that we can see!  Many animals have tails, like tigers, some monkeys, and elephants.  Some animals do not have tails, though, like a gorilla or a hamster.
